title: Overworld_Elder
body:
As you walk through the village square, you spot the elder sitting on a wooden bench, watching the passersby. When you approach, the elder's face lights up with a warm smile.

Elder: "Oh hello, traveller! I've been looking for you everywhere! It seems as if...

[[I could use your help with a small matter!|elder_request]]"

title: elder_request
body:
Elder: "I have a bit of trouble with that new gadget my grandson sent me. These newfangled devices confuse me, but you seem to know your way around them. Could you spare a moment to help?"

[[Agree to help the elder with their device.|Start_Elder]]
[[Politely decline, saying you're in a rush.|elder_decline]]

title: elder_decline
body:
Elder: "Ah, I understand, dear. You're busy, and time waits for no one! Perhaps later, when you're free."

You bid farewell, knowing the elder will be waiting patiently for help.

title: Overworld_Teacher
body:
You stroll through the school grounds, noticing Mr. Rhodes pacing nervously outside the computer lab. He waves excitedly as soon as he spots you.

Mr. Rhodes: "Oh hello, traveller! I've been looking for you everywhere! It seems as if... 

[[We have a bit of a tech emergency on our hands.|teacher_request]]"

title: teacher_request
body:
Mr. Rhodes: "The computer lab’s main machine is acting up again, and you’re the only one who seems to know how to handle it! Would you mind lending a hand before the class starts?"

[[Agree to help Mr. Rhodes troubleshoot.|Start_Teacher]]
[[Decline, mentioning you have other pressing matters.|teacher_decline]]

title: teacher_decline
body:
Mr. Rhodes: "Ah, no worries! I know you've got your own adventures to handle. If you change your mind, I'll be here fighting with the tech until then."

You give a nod of understanding and continue on your way.

title: Start_Elder
body:
You enter the elder's cozy living room, and they ask for help setting up a new device.

[[Help the elder set up the device.|setup_instructions]]

title: setup_instructions
body:
Elder: "Thank you, dear. My eyes aren't as sharp as they used to be, and these screens seem to get smaller and smaller! My grandson says it's just a few simple steps to get this up and running."

[[Select language for the device.|step_1]]

title: step_1
body:
You select a language for the device.

[[Connect to the home Wi-Fi network.|step_2]]

title: step_2
body:
You connect the device to the home Wi-Fi network.

[[Sign in with the provided email or create a new account.|step_3]]

title: step_3
body:
You sign in with the elder's email.

[[Configure basic settings like text size and accessibility options.|step_4]]

title: step_4
body:
You adjust the text size and accessibility settings, making the device comfortable for the elder to use.

[[End of setup.|elder_end]]

title: elder_end
body: Elder: "Thank you so much! I can actually see what I'm doing now. You're a lifesaver!"

title: Start_Teacher
body:
You arrive at school and see Mr. Rhodes struggling with a computer in the lab.

[[Offer to help Mr. Rhodes.|teacher_help]]

title: teacher_help
body:
Mr. Rhodes: "Ah, just the person I need! This computer is glitching, and the whole class will need it for our lesson today. Think you can help me troubleshoot?"

[[Start troubleshooting the computer.|troubleshoot_start]]

title: troubleshoot_start
body:
You pull out your toolkit and diagnostic USB, ready to fix the issues.

[[Tackle the corrupted files first.|corrupted_files]]

title: corrupted_files
body:
You open the file diagnostics tool and use 'System Restore.' The corrupted files are repaired!

[[Move on to the slow processor.|slow_processor]]

title: slow_processor
body:
You perform a 'Fan Clean-Up,' boosting the computer's performance.

[[Confront the final challenge: a virus threat.|virus_threat]]

title: virus_threat
body:
You plug in the 'Anti-Virus Flash Drive' and eliminate the virus. The computer is back to normal!

[[Celebrate with Mr. Rhodes.|victory_celebration]]

title: victory_celebration
body:
Mr. Rhodes: "Great job! And hey, let's tell the class about why tech care is important."

[[Talk to the class about tech maintenance.|class_lesson]]

title: class_lesson
body:
You explain the importance of tech maintenance and how simple troubleshooting can prevent problems.

Mr. Rhodes: "Remember, technology helps us every day. Treat it well, and it’ll treat you well back!"
